reviewText: I played the android version of this game. I bought it to see what it was like on PC.\n\nThe good parts of the game would be - having lot of levels, different gods to choose from (about 20) and some form of strategical placement when it comes to using your spells. By that, I mean that you don't just simply spam the spells as much as you want. You have to make the humans like you by casting good" spells in order to gain worship
date: which is the resource used to cast other
recommended: more offensive spells for destroying their tower. Basically
hoursPlayed: you have to find a balance between appeasing the humans and ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ them off by destroying their tower.  It's an interesting combination which makes it unique and offers some depth in the otherwise very standard affair of stopping bad guys from getting from one end to the other.\n\nNow for the bad. The game is an android port. It certainly looks like one and plays like one. The menus on 1920x1080 look pixelated and stretched while the models and textures are pretty lackluster. It's not ugly
voteText: but it's not pretty either. The game also starts getting pretty hectic later on
helpfulPercent: where the difficulty wasn't too well thought out and instead of thinking about enemy unit combinations and synergy
votesHelpful: they basically throw in as many of the big units as possible to give some semblance of difficulty. After a while
votesTotal: the game also starts to feel like a grind
votesFunny: but what do you expect from a tower defence game?\n\nProblems aside
commentsCount: this game is pretty good for how much it costs
column16: especially with the sale. It's a solid defence game with some nice depth to keep you interested. It's going to feel like a grind at times but if you don't mind it too much

reviewText:
Review from a dad on a budget. Check out my podcast Steam on the Cheap where I review cheap games and let you know if they are worth your money.
https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/steam-on-cheap-discovering/id899847567?mt=2

Gods vs Humans is a quirky tower defence style game that does not reinvent the genre but does add a neat twist.
Here is my video review and keep reading for a more indepth review here.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UXhq07wcPw8&feature=youtu.be

First off this game has a lot of depth for a $7 dollar game. The idea is simple. You are one of 20 different gods trying to stop the humans from building a tower to destroy you. Through the levels you will play as Egyptian, Greek, Nordic, and Japanese gods each with unique settings, tower and powers. (Nice rhyme i know)

Each god has their specific set of powers as well as commons ones shared. You will use your powers to destroy pillars to bring down a section of the temple until the whole temple collapses. If the humans reach you then boom your dead and they are now gods. By the way you don’t want that to happen.

The difficulty ramps up because following old mythology you get you power from the worship of humans so if you harm them while destroying the tower they become angry with you and severely limits your power. Also there are evil priests that try to convert the humans and supervisors you have to keep happy or else the workers will repair the pillars faster than you can destroy them. There are also protectors on some floors that will counteract certain spells meaning you can use fire on a level or maybe lighting on a different one.

So far I am finding this game to be very challenging and one that I can't stop playing because I want to see what they are going to throw at me next.

As of now I am recommending this game even more so because it is half off so it is definitely worth it.

I will update this review if I find anything that changes my mind or find things that are cool and you should not about. Don’t forget to click yes if you found this review helpful Thanks :)

Update 5 hours in and still enjoying this game. It does get pretty hard so prepare to get frustrated here and there :)

reviewText: This game was ok on phone, but for a desktop version much more could be done. Like, I don't know, gathering faith represented by tokens, to purchase powers/upgrades. It feels too much repetitive and slow. I could hardly make it through 4 levels without shutting it down. The tendention of porting mobile games to PC is kind of a problem right now. No, I'm not saying that all ported games are weak. But this one surely belongs to long subway rides, not Steam.

reviewText:
So I read the other negative reviews, but I thought if the game was simple it might be a casual game timesoak for my young nieces and nephews when they visit, and at the price offered (on sale) I went for it.

I should have listened to the other reviews.

For me the game is boring. The same stuff level after level. However for my young nieces and nephews the game interface is too convoluted.

If you have nothing to live for and nothing to do with your time, then maybe this game is for you.

reviewText:
4.7/10 – Borderline, but ultimately not good.

I like the idea but it's just not that fun. You are tasked with being a God; I have lots of experience with that so it wasn't a problem. You have to destroy the structure of your insolent worshipers. You have a plethora of God-like spells to use, as you fight to bring it down.

I didn't like that if you focus on the bottom of the tower you could complete the level more quickly than you should. It is unique that you have to zoom in on different sections of the tower with a mini-map. However, since you can just destroy the bottom level it's somewhat irrelevant.

Worth a dollar.

reviewText:
[This is not a review you would expect, consider this as slightly angry comment]

There is something wrong with game which cannot grasp my attention within 30 minutes (or less).
I don´t care what it is, just give me anything to lean on.

Gods vs Humans didn't deliver nothing worthwhile. Click, click, click to destroy towers, watch them fall, and proceed to the next level. That's it.
I don´t mind casual games and I am not arguing there is no level of challenge later on, sure it might be, but i just don´t want to waste my time to looking for challenge and something interesting. I can go and pick another game from my collection, here on Steam, and i bet you, i can find something more appealing, more fun, more enjoyable, what can bring  joy from playing games in an instant and i can just unwind.

Visuals are just ok, music is not my tune, and overall i was just numb thru this 20 minutes.
No thanks.

1/10

reviewText: An interesting tower defense-esque game.  Essentially, you're a god who's trying to prevent the humans from reaching you via a tower they are building.  It'll be up to you to keep them happy and knock down their tower at the same time.  Anger them, and your worship" points trickle in much more slowly (preventing you from using god powers as often).  They also work faster when they're angry
date:
which is bad.  There's a lot here for $3.50 (on sale until Oct 17) including 20 gods across 96 levels.  Worth checking out at the very least.

reviewText:
Gods vs Humans is a fun action-strategy game with a huge amount of levels and mythologies - the amount of content in this game is staggering!

I love tower-defence style games, this game is a nice little twist on the genre. It feels very much like a mobile game, but has enough desktop gameplay elements to strike the right balance and be enjoyable on the big screen. The game starts at a slow pace and builds up as you progress!

It has humour, fun gameplay mechanics and a colourful palette!

Recommended!
voteText: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I thought that maybe this would be a game to spend time playing while other things download. The problem is, it's way to repetitive. I got bored about halfway through the tutorial, but I pressed on, because I thought it might get better from there. It did not. The interface is rather sloppily put together, with the numbers on the abilities not actually working, and just having an overall feel of being designed solely for mobile and then simply released as a PC game. Even the sale price I bought it at is too much to be asked for. In my opinion, the developers should either have spent a lot more time on the PC interface, or just stuck to mobile-exclusive.

reviewText: This is by far one of the most repetitive-boring games I've ever played. I bought this game expecting a fun strategy game to waste time with, but instead I lost out on $5 that I could've used to buy something else. First of all, this game is extremely repetitive; the levels never change, there is absolutely no deviation from the basic formula of winning each level (spam on the first floor: win game.) Second of all, this game is not at all fun. There is nothing stimulating in it; there is no change, nothing interesting, and is just not worth it. I say this warning with all there is inside me: DONT BUY THIS GAME. DO NOT BUY IT ON SALE, DONT EVEN LOOK AT IT, AVOID IT LIKE THE PLAGUE. Spend the current price to charity, not this piece of garbage procieved as a game, you'll get a lot more out of it.
